intro: Hieracium chaunothyrsum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. It has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and can reach up to 20 cm in length. Hieracium chaunothyrsum is often found in open habitats and can spread readily through its rhizomes.
